ruleset.name: Naming Rules (JavaTddPlugin version)
ruleset.description: The Naming Ruleset contains a collection of rules about names - too long, too short, and so forth. This version of the ruleset includes alternate messages from the main PMD rulesets/naming.xml ruleset.

rule.message: The name of this method is probably not very descriptive. Using descriptive method names (at least three characters) makes it easier for a reader to understand what the method is supposed to do.

This method has the same name as the class that contains it. Did you intend this method to be a constructor? If so, remember constructors do not have a return type. If not, you should pick a new name for this method.
This field has the same name as the class that contains it. This is not illegal but it can be very confusing and is best avoided. You should pick a new name for this field.
